page.title: 13BOAT-BUILDING
page.content: On{Shapinsay}there is a boat builder. He makes{fishing boats}from 10 to 30 feet long.Usually he can make 6 small boats in a year and 1_2 big ones.The wood used is{oak}and{larch}which comes from Dingwall in the north of Scotland.When the wood arrives it is in rough planks with the bark still on.The boat builder has to{plane}it {sand}it and{treat}it till it is suitable for use. He also has to cut it to size. First, he lays the{keel then sets the{ribs. }Next the side planks have to be{steamed}into shape before being nailed onto the ribs. The {nails}are made of{copper}which won't rust.They are so expensive he doesn't buy many at a time. At the moment he is so busy, two men work for him.The boat they are working on is for{prawn fishing.}It will go to the Black Isle Ross-shire.
